title: Deprecate and redirect the old API endpoints

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Internal code changes that don't add or remove functionality

body:
Extracted from https://github.com/octobox/octobox/pull/2852

Now that we have a new api, the old endpoints still work but have duplicate logic, they should be redirected to the new api with a deprecation notice and eventually removed.

title: API for threadview and comments
body:
Extracted from https://github.com/octobox/octobox/pull/2852

Currently there isn't a way to load or create comments via the octobox api, would be nice to be able to perform all functions via the api, although this is low priority as you can use the regular github api to do the same thing.

title: [Feature request] Add option to follow the System Theme

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: Issues that affect access for certain users

body:
## 💥 Proposal

Add a third Theme options: Follow System Default theme.

## Motivation

Most modern apps and websites offer at least 3 themes by default:

- Light
- Dark
- System Default

Octobox is missing the third one. The System Default theme would follow the theme set by the browser and automatically switch to the appropriate one accordingly.

The browser can also follow the System Default theme itself: If the user switches the OS theme to light or dark, the browser changes its theme, and then it would tell Octobox to change the theme as well.

## Pitch

Some modern OSs have the ability to detect the sunrise and sunset time based on the user's location, and switch to a light theme on sunrise or to a dark theme on sunset. This prevents eye strain.

Some other OSs do not have the ability to detect sunrise/sunset, but the user can still manually switch to Light or Dark theme on demand.

In an ideal world, the user would _only_ switch the theme at the OS level, and _all_ apps would follow that setting.

If you have threadview enabled, clicking on a notification of a new release shows broken links due to the lack of user:
![Screenshot 2021-11-09 at 10 22 24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1060/140907143-21f6bec1-2213-4740-ba7a-832668a9a691.png)

title: Add support for github checks along side statuses
body:
We currently have support for the status api, showing pass/fail/error for pull requests with older CI integrations, new CI integrations like GitHub actions use a different ["checks"](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/checks) api.

This will extra permissions on the GitHub App (`checks:read`) which enables checks [webhooks](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/webhook-events-and-payloads#check_suite), from there the integration should be very similar to the existing status one, I think we can use the same `status` field in our database from the `conclusion` field in the check webhook body.

title: Support for subjects without a notification record from GitHub
body:
Working on making octobox able to create notifications for subjects (issues, prs etc) that don't have a remote notification record on GitHub (i.e. where `github_id` is null)

Some example use cases:

- user stars a subject without an existing notification
  - download subject and create a starred notification with null github_id 

- user subscribes to a subject without an existing notification (can only be done in extension atm)
  - download subject and create a starred notification with null github_id 

- user imports subjects created by themselves
  - download subject and create a notification with null github_id 

Things to carefully check for:

- [ ] ensure notification functions that use github_id can handle nulls
- [ ] ensure notifications without github_id get properly merged/updated/replaced when a real notification for a subject is generated by GitHub
- [ ] Users may need more oauth scopes to enable full access to all issues and pull requests

Related issues:
- https://github.com/octobox/octobox/issues/2821
- https://github.com/octobox/octobox/issues/2456
- https://github.com/octobox/octobox/issues/2310
- https://github.com/octobox/octobox/issues/2302

Current todo list:

- [x] subject's need to record or infer their `subject_type`
- [x] subject's should record their `title`
- [ ] Mute button should be disabled if `github_id` is `nil`
- [ ] `Notification.mute` should ignore internal notifications
- [ ] `Notification.mark_read` should ignore internal notifications
- [ ] When syncing a user, download and create internal notifications for subjects they created that don't existing notifications (skip inbox)

title: Allow starring of any subject, even if you haven't been notified for it yet
body:
Related issue on the extension repo: https://github.com/octobox/extension/issues/7

I'm going to be experimenting with expanding Octobox to hold more things, allowing users to use it to build workflows that help their personal productivity whilst using GitHub. 

One of the first things is to be able to star issues and pull requests to come back to later that you might not have received a notification for yet i.e. it doesn't exist in your Octobox inbox.

This will involve doing some merging behind the scenes for handling when a real notification is triggered for an issue that you had already starred.

title: Pinned search counts should update via websockets
body:
If the state of a notification changes due to a webhook delivery, currently the list view will update automatically via websocket but the pinned search count does not, it would be nice if the count updated automatically as well.

We can't easily know which pinned search counts may have changed, so we can update them all every time there's a websocket event that triggers a change.

title: Octobox with existing repositories/projects
body:
Are you experiencing this issue in octobox.io or your own instance?
 - [x] octobox.io
 - [ ] My instance

If your issue is related to an Octobox.io subscription purchase please ensure you have installed the [Octobox GitHub App](https://github.com/apps/octobox) for the repositories concerned.

### Summary of Problem

- What are you trying to do?  *Use Octobox as a dashboard for issues and PRs, with the intent to get a better and clearer overview of various search queries result counts.*
- What happens?  *It only seems to work for changes to/in issues and PRs that were made AFTER I configured Octobox.*
- What should have happened?  *Once having configured Octobox, given all the permissions and even installing the Octobox GitHub App, I should have been able to see all issues and PRs, and their related data such as labels etc, in Octobox - not just the ones that were added or changed after I configured Octobox, but everything starting from when the project repository on GitHub was created.*

### Steps to Reproduce the Issue

Set up and configure your Octobox with a many years old project on GitHub. You will see that only issues/PRs being changed/added THEREAFTER will show up in Octobox, even if you hit the Sync button and what not.

### Versions, Operating System and Hardware

- Which version/commit of Octobox are you using?  *Whichever is the one served on Octobox.io*
- Which browser are you accessing Octobo with?  *Safari and Chrome, no difference*
- Windows? Linux? Mac?  *Mac*
- How are you deploying Octobox (Docker, Heroku, Openshift, etc)  *Using Octobox.io*

### Additional comments

I see the concept of Notifications being mentioned a lot in Octobox, which indicates it's using notifications to gather data from GitHub. But where you get info about the GitHub app it seems to suggest that if you install that, you will be able to suck in labels etc. Nowhere that I've read has there been anything suggesting that Octobox can only handle "future" issues/PRs or changes thereto. This seems highly unclear, given the symptoms I'm seeing, and should probably be clarified somewhere.

title: Support grouping of the issue list by repo
body:
## 💥 Proposal

### What feature you'd like to see
I'd like to be able to group issues by repository in the main notification list. Bonus: Be able to sort the repo groupings according to a custom ranking order.

## Motivation
In our company we work on many repositories, which means issues from all those repos appear in the same list, intermingled with each other. I know there's a filtering mechanism to look at a single repo at a time, but often times I want to see issues from all repos, just a little bit more organized (i.e. grouped) into their respective repos.

## Pitch

Octobox claims to "untangle your github notifications", but seeing notifications from all repos mixed with each other is still "tangled". This feature would be a great push for octobox towards its goal ;)

title: Link to issues.
body:
## 💥 Proposal

### What feature you'd like to see

Link to issues on github on issue view / menu view.

## Motivation

Not everything renders correctly in octobox, and stuff is squashed, it would be useful to jump an issue out and see it in the original context.

## Pitch

A link from the issue number displayed in the view to its actual page would make it easy to jump out and use the full github setup rather than cramped in a sidebar)

title: How do I run the test suite with the docker-compose command?

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Both user and developer docs and support

body:
The [Docker setup instructions](https://github.com/octobox/octobox/blob/master/docs/INSTALLATION.md#using-docker-and-docker-compose) do not show how to run the test suite with the docker-compose command.  I've successfully set up the app and started the Rails server with the following command (which is in the instructions):
```
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=yourclientid GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=yourclientsecret docker-compose up --build
```
What is the docker-compose command for running the test suite?   It should be added to the Docker setup instructions.
